cards.flavorText: Atarka goblins meet their demise as readily as their Temur counterparts did, but usually under big, winged shadows.
cards.name: Dragon Fodder
cards.text: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

cards.flavorText: Atarka serving-goblins coat themselves with grease imbued with noxious herbs, hoping to discourage their ravenous masters from adding them to the meal.
cards.name: Dragonlord's Servant

rulings.text: Dragonlord’s Servant can’t reduce the colored mana requirement of a Dragon spell you cast.
If there are any additional costs to cast a Dragon spell, apply those before applying Dragonlord’s Servant and any other cost reductions.
The ability can apply to alternative costs to cast a Dragon spell.

cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Foe-Razer Regent

rulings.text: You choose the target of the first triggered ability as it goes on the stack, but you choose whether or not to fight as that ability resolves.
If the target creature you don’t control becomes an illegal target of the first triggered ability before it resolves, Foe-Razer Regent won’t fight and its last ability won’t trigger.
If a creature you control fights during an end step, the delayed triggered ability that puts +1/+1 counters on that creature won’t trigger until the beginning of the following turn’s end step.

cards.text:
Flying
When Foe-Razer Regent enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.
Whenever a creature you control fights, put two +1/+1 counters on it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavorText: The land is ever resilient. Should it die, it will be reborn.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
